synthesis_conditions.description: Compound 1 was synthesized according to the literature procedure and exhibited identical spectral properties to those reported.
When reagent 3 was treated with silver cyanate, a mixture of isomeric 1-cyanatobenziodoxoles was obtained, with the major product arising from reaction at the nitrogen atom.
The reaction of 3 with silver thiocyanate yielded a single compound that did not contain the expected benziodoxole scaffold.

steps.description: Aryl iodide reacted with arylboronic acid in the presence of Pd(OAc)2, SPhos, and K3PO4 in toluene at 110°C for 18 hours.
The product from step 1 was treated with pTsOH in CH3CN, followed by KI and NaNO2 in H2O for 5 hours.
MeMgBr was added to the product from step 2 in Et2O at 40°C for 5 hours.
tBuOCl was added to the product from step 3 in THF/CH2Cl2 (2:1) for 2 hours.
AgSCF3 was reacted with the product from step 4 in THF at 50°C for 1 hour.

synthesis_conditions.description: The MOF material was prepared by slow diffusion of a solution of ZnI2 in methanol into the solution of 2,4,6-tri(4-pyridyl)-1,3,5-triazine in a mixture of nitrobenzene and methanol. Soaking the resulting crystals in cyclohexane at 50°C for two weeks allowed for the majority of nitrobenzene in the pores of the MOF to be exchanged with more labile cyclohexane molecules. A consecutive soak of the crystals in the analyte provided X-ray quality crystals of the host–guest complex 1@MOF.
